review.description:
Great place for amazing food selections.... Limited.
Nice and brand new food court. Check it out. 
I was at Katz famous rebuen sandwich.
review.author: Arif K.

review.description: The whole place was really diverse and full of wonderful food. I enjoyed that the staff in every stall was very friendly. Although it gets packed and there are barely places to sit, you can get a great meal for a good price. I recommend the LaZhao Noodles at the Hana Bar along with the churros because that was worth the buy! Definitely returning! They also accept card in case cash isn't your forté. :)
review.author: Lissa C.

review.description:
Probably the best food market I've been to- it's large& spacious with mind boggling options. The first few times I went, it would take a good 10 mins to decide what I wanted. Personal faves are: 
Foragers (great breakfast sandwiches)
Arepa lady 
Dekalb taco (the BEST chicken quesadilla although small portions) 
Eight turn Crepe
Forcellas (pizza place but has BEST Arancini rice balls)
Home frites 
Jianbing company
review.author: S S.

review.description: This is by far the best food hall in NYC.  They have numerous choices including Katz's and Ample Hills(two reasons to go anywhere).  It's very popular and seating is not great but on off times it's easy to get a seat.
review.author: Michelle L.

review.description: Great cheesesteak & truffle fries at home frite !!! A must try believe me you won't regret it !!!
review.author: China M.

review.description:
It's a great location with many food options. With it being a food hall there is definitely portion control and a bit pricey. But I would say great to eat and shop. Can't wait for more stores to rent out levels 1-3. 

I tried the classic Hawaiian poke shop and it was super yummy. (After I finished the bowl and I wanted a second one.) I also tried the beef noodle soup from the hand pulled noodle shop (behind the elevator) and it was pretty good except the soup was really salty. Lastly I tried the peppermint patty ample hill ice cream shop and it was bomb! I would go for the medium bowl next time as the large looked reasonable but I couldn't finish it. 

(Note: I like this mall better than Atlantic Avenue mall. Definitely different neighborhood just 1 train stop away from each other)
review.author: Brenda M.

review.description: Great set up however the space is a bit small for all of these vendors and can turn into a pretty tight cluster. I especially enjoyed the mini doughnut stand!  Don't come here during peak hours u ll be waiting in line for a while.
review.author: Tamara P.

review.description: Amazing food options- my only critique is that they play really loud rap music early in the morning on the weekends. It makes it difficult to have conversations.
review.author: Rebecca A.

review.description: I think it's a great market! Located in the industrial chic lower level of the City Point building with a Trader Joe's, Target, Movie Theater, and a few other little shops, it's a fun hub to visit and get some quality food. So many to choose from it can be overwhelming. From pizza and calzones to Chinese. They have fresh cheeses and a butcher. They have bagels and a pastry station, they have a station where you go down the line and choose one item of each list creating an entire home cooked type of meal. It is very clean. They have quite a bit of seating but depending on when you go it can be very hard to get one. This is located right by the Dekalb subway station making it a great place if you are on the go and want to grab a bite.
review.author: Chelsea D.

review.description: This place is one of our favorite places to eat in Brooklyn. The have lots of different kinds of food. We've loved eating patacones, paella, fried chicken, fries, and plenty more.
review.author: Caleb C.

review.description: Like this place alot. Like an indoor smorgasbord.  Great food selections.  Would like to see more wine n liquor options but they do have a huge beer selection.   More seats coming too.  will be back!
review.author: Keshia H.

review.description: This place is amazing..EXPENSIVE (like everything else in NYC) ,  but where else can you find 40 different eateries under 1 roof where there is also a Trader Joe's?! And a Target right upstairs?! This place is what dreams are made of!! . So far I'm stuck on Two Tablespoons.  They're a vegetarian/began eatery...their food is just soooo damn delicious! I've also tried Hana Noodle Station. It was enjoyable too. But man, Two Tablespoons is where it's at!
review.author: Leslie G.

review.description: Almost everything a foodie could want.... all in one place. Especially important to try the pierogies and crepes. YAS!
review.author: Andi C.

review.description: This is one of the reason why I live in the same building! Dekalb Market Hall have everything I need. City Point in particular have loads to offer. The market hall have Katz and all other Instagram worthy food stalls.  It has also Trader Joe's, Target, and Century 21, Alamo Movie House in one same area hence having a quick bite here is so worth it
review.author: Kit N.

review.description: I visited the market and it feels like a street in Japan. I decided to eat at Fletcher Brooklyn BBQ and it was a great choice. I ordered the chicken sandwich, the chicken was so flavorful and so was the BBQ sauce. The waffle fries looked amazing, I might get them next time along with ribs. There are about 40 vendors so you have numerous options. The only downside is that the sitting is limited.
review.author: Safe H.

review.description: We came to the new Target Store to buy stuff for a new apartment. We were in a hurry but managed to check out the new mall that also includes Flying Tiger and Trader Joe's among other stores. We were very impressed by what we saw. The Foodcourt looks especially inviting, with many food stalls offering a wide variety of choices from beer to Chinese noodles to poke to other cuisines. We tried out the Wiki Wiki poke bowl this time but will definitely be back to check out others. Just the fact that this amazing mall is conveniently located here now is heartwarming and certainly a wonderful enhancement for the neighborhood.
review.author: Geri C.

review.description: Underground lair of food stall deliciousness. Fun vibe. Great for eating with a group who likes to explore. Shanghai pancakes, Hawaiian, French pastries, vegan delicious bowls. So much more. Beer and wine. Great prices for NY. Prepare for crowds, be willing to eat at a stand up bar, and you have a fun spot with expansive choices. I'm traveling solo and had a great time. Even better with mates.
review.author: Darcie V.

review.description: It was exciting coming here, the reconstruction and renovations were massive compared to the old Albee Square/Metro tech Mall. I see the community has readily accepted the new stores and organization by seeing the large crowd of people. It's a fun place to shop and Wander.
review.author: Arthur R.

review.description: Awesome place to get an assortment of food at the food court. Not your typical food court.
review.author: Ruben G.

review.description: It's a very nice place to hangout and try culinary foods in one place. Just not enough comfortable seating
review.author: Jane T.
